result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy A. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Absolutely no contact with the victim.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling ordered by the agent.  

Pay costs.  (If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.)

Submit DNA sample at the RCSD before signing up for probation.  

Parties stipulate to 2 days credit in the event of revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy A. King in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advise that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution calling for dismissal of the battery count/count 1 for plea to disorderly conduct/count 2.  Def pleads no contest to count 2.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty on count 2.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.  Service rep BB addresses Court on behalf of the victim.  12 mo probation with absolute no contact.  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any counseling ordered by agent.  Pay costs.  Submit DNA sample at RCSD before signing up for probation.  Costs to be paid as condition of probation.  2 days credit in the event of revocation.

Defendant Timothy A. King in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties.  NG pleas entered. Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Timothy A. King who appeared in person. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court informs def of charges. Request made to adjourn for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
